docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON The Senate voted early Friday morning to force final action on a Pentagon spending measure as Democrats broke a Republican attempt to use the military money to stall action on the health care overhaul. In an unusual dead-of-night session that opened just after midnight, senators voted 63 to 33 to shut off debate on the $626 billion plan, which is the last spending measure due to pass this year and was easily passed by the House earlier this week. A final vote is expected early Saturday.
docs.snippet: The Senate voted early Friday to force final action on a Pentagon spending measure as Democrats broke a G.O.P. attempt to use the military money to stall action on the health care overhaul.
